title: love island quiz finale 2019
story: Because you’d hardly describe this year’s intake as “lovable”.In fact, with the odd exception , they’ve probably been the most cliquey, manipulative, fork-tongued and spineless bunch so far.The abundance of storylines they’ve produced, though, means Love Island remains a television phenomenon. So let’s not pretend I don’t need the show every bit as much as the Love Islanders deserve the low-grade abuse contained in this quiz, whichtests just how closely you’ve been watching. Answers at foot of page.. Who was Curtis referring to when he said: “You are gorgeous. You are beautul. You are literally a star ”. Complete Maura’s sentence. “I’ve only ever slept with . . . ”. Tommy said: “I believe le’s a test.” But what did he think was “the prize” . What is the name of Tommy and Molly-Mae’s cuddly elephant toy . Who or what was Arabella talking about here  “Downward dog, inhale and I’m into the plank.”. What sex position did Harley tell Chris was her favourite on their very first day as a “couple” . What words appear directly above Caroline Flack’s name in the end credits . Before entering the villa, Anton joked: “I’ve got this serious medical condition.” What was it . Who did Michael describe as “a real-le hero” . Complete Anna’s sentence. “Is it right that no matter where you are in the world, you’re looking at . . . ”. Molly-Mae said: “I feel in a few years’ time we won’t have enough doctors, nurses, dentists. Kids these days don’t want to study.” What does Molly-Mae do for a living . Who did Yewande say she hates watching on television . Joanna laughed: “I’m going into the villa for . . . ”. What does Jourdan think Barcelona is . Who were the first two people to enter the villa . Having told a distressed Amy, “You’re better than that . A proper f***ing joke”, what did Maura do next . What did George do before entering the villa . What fact was Belle astonished to discover about Edinburgh BBC’s This Week has, by and large, been a force for political good since it started in .Yes, it did tend to attract the very worst sort of guests. Out-of-their- depth left-wing comedians , -ton Euro smuggernauts like Benedicte Paviot, the professionally indignant Owen Jones and all those other political trainspotters and obsessive social misfits who make le a slightly bigger ballache than it needs to be for the . per cent of the population who don’t think a day is incomplete without an argument about NHS funding.Every single one of the above, however, got exactly what they deserved on This Week, where they were mercilessly torn to shreds by Andrew Neil, who firmly established himself as television’s greatest political interviewer during its -year history.Unforgettably, it also produced the funniest TV moment of  when an incredibly po-faced Bobby Gillespie, of Primal Scream, refused to join in the Skibidi dance challenge with Neil, Michael Portillo and Caroline Flint MP.So it’s a shame This Week has been axed and I’d hoped the last episode, on Thursday, would give it the smart, brutal, nicely understated send-off this fine show deserved.What it got was Piers Morgan, some fat bloke from thedressed as Danny Zuko from Grease, Portillo dancing around in his pants and a fright wig to Look At Me, I’m Sandra Dee and Mick Hucknall serenading Neil with a chorus of Nobody Does It Better.Yet still some people insist politics is just “showbiz for ugly people”. Nighty-night.Jamie Weir: “Without resorting to cliches, golf is like a religion in Ireland.”And Boris Becker: “If game A doesn’t work, Federer goes to game C. Andthat doesn’t work, game B.”THE Lateish Show, Mo Gilligan to Jessie J: “You’re in a high-profile relationship with Channing Tatum. I saw on Instagram he lost a bet ”CHANNEL ’s beautul, moving and entertaining series Extreme Tribe: The Last Pygmies finished on an uncertain note for the Mbendjele people of the Congo, last night.A road is being built through their jungle home which could bring wealth but also destroy their hunter-gatherer way of le.If that message chilled the bones of millennials, imagine what this next bombshell, dropped by presenter Livia Simoka, did for those of us in the - age bracket.“The Mbendjele people drink palm wine.”In other words, contrary to everything we were told last century, a hippo didn’t take “an apricot, a guava and a mango and do a dainty tango”. Nor did the rhino say, “I know, we’ll call it Um Bongo.”Um Bongo Um Bongo, they don’t drink it in the Congo at all. It was just another neo-colonialist establishment marketing lie.And honestly,you can’t even believe in catchy mid-Eighties advertising jingles any more, what the hell can you believe in This Morning chef Brian Turner: “I don’t know about you, Eamonn, but when we have three chickens for Sunday lunch, there’s always something left over.”Left  Over  Nope, you’ve lost him, Brian.And it’s four chickens.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: inside hamptons mansion beyonce jay z
story: The home, known as Sandcastle, sprawls over three stories and close to  acres with  separate bathrooms, a -foot heated pool, rock-climbing wall and bowling alley.Fit for the celebrity couple, the home in celebrity hot spot Bridgehampton, is billed as the ultimate choice in luxury, relaxation and entertainment.Jay Z and Beyonce reportedly filmed a music video in the lush property grounds, taking their daughter Blue Ivy there in  for her first summer.At that time, the couple paid , for their month-long stay, Forbes reported.And now - depending on the season - holidaygoers can expect to fork out as much as million for their stay.The Bespoke Real Estate listing reads: Indulge in any activity your heart desires in this all-inclusive setting.A recreational pavilion, sunken tennis court with a pergola, ’ x ’ gunite pool with underwater stereo, an oversized hot tub, full outdoor kitchen, basketball court, baseball field and tree house assure something for everyone.The homes grand interior opens up to a magnicent entry hall with elegant bordeaux walnut heated floors, extensive custom millwork, architectural ceilings and high-end finishes.The first level takes guests to an expansive double living room, complete with two fireplaces.A wall of glass doors leads to an outdoor patio retreat.The regal dining room is designed for large-scale entertaining with a butler’s pantry, chef’s kitchen walk-in refrigeration room, and wine room attached.A stately library, ten-seat theatre with interactive seating and a planetarium also reside on the first floor.Rising to the second floor via elevator, guests can find sleeping quarters and the master suite with a sitting room, wet bar, powder room and master closets.The indulgent master bath is surrounded by honey onyx slabs, and an expansive terrace with an outdoor shower.An additional five bedrooms all with en-suite bathrooms are also on the second floor.Separate guest quarters with full apartment amenities including laundry, two bedrooms, private entrance and an eight bunkbed room are attached.In the homes expansive lower level, guests can relax in the private spa suite with a spa room with a fireplace complete with two hydraulic massage tables, jacuzzi, sauna, steam room, massage area, and showers.And those who need to stay fit can find squash, racquetball, basketball and volleyball courts with a fully-equipped training room and gym.A state-of-the-art entertainment lounge features a rock-climbing wall, skateboarding half-pipe, arts and crafts area, DJ booth and recording area, as well as a two-lane bowling alley.An enormous recreation pavilion features a yoga studio with fireplace, changing room, gym, covered porch, billiard area, steam room, massage room, and pilates room.Renowned Hamptons developer Joe Farrell expertly designed the mansion which has catered for several celebrity guests.He told property site The Real Deal last year: “If I had built to sell, I never would have put in so many of those things ... Things you’d never get your money back on, like closets that were hundreds of thousands of dollars.”In , Beyonce and husband Jay Z reportedly bought a mansion in The Hamptons for a cool m.The superstar couple, who are parents to daughter Blue and twins Sir and Rumi, are often seen on holiday in lavish and glamorous locations.Beyonce chilled out on the yacht with Blue Ivy on a recent trip to Italy

title: deal boris follow may brexit door
story: He is only Prime Minister because of Theresa May’s failure to get Britain out of the EU on March .If Boris can’t get Brexit done, then he’ll be done.So what’s the plan  Well, it is to seek a deal while preparing for No Deal.Boris has long regarded a genuine threat to walk away without a deal as being a bit like the Trident nuclear deterrent: Because you have it, you don’t have to use it.But as one of those involved in devising this approach tells me, for it to work, “both elements of the strategy have to be credible”. In other words, both the No Deal preparation and the proposed deal must be realistic.This is where his key Brexit lieutenants Dominic Cummings and David Frost come in.They might be backroom appointments but they are as —not more — important to the success of Boris’s premiership as the Cabinet appointments he has made.Cummings is a unique figure in Westminster. He is interested in getting things done with little regard to what people think of him and the political niceties.It is thanks to Benedict Cumberbatch that Cummings has attracted something close to celebrity status in political circles. Cumberbatch played Cummings in the TV drama Brexit: The Uncivil War.He captured brilliantly Cummings’ drive and determination to win as the campaign chief for Vote Leave, and the fact he doesn’t care whose ego he ruffles in the process.In his new job, Cummings’ determination is already clear.Yesterday he was meant to be on the operating table under general anaesthetic.But once the offer came from Boris, he cancelled the operation. I am told he won’t have it done now until after October , Boris’s deadline for getting Brexit done.Cummings came in because the chance of getting the Vote Leave team back together to deliver Brexit after three years of drt simply had to be taken. The big challenge for this team is to get the UK ready for a No Deal Brexit.Cummings is well suited to his task. He knows how Whitehall works and how to succeed despite intense opposition he drove through Michael Gove’s Free Schools, which have proved hugely successful, against the objections of the educational establishment.Strikingly, in Boris’s new Government it is now Gove who is in charge of the No Deal planning.Getting the logistics and the necessary contingency plans sorted is one aspect of No Deal planning, and one that was shamefully neglected under Mrs May. But there also needs to be a political strategy for it.Many in the EU are convinced — thanks to the antics of Dominic Grieve, Philip Hammond and co — that Parliament will block No Deal.Or thatthe UK did leave without a deal on Halloween, it would come crawling back by Christmas.So they reckon there is no need to compromise as No Deal either won’t happen or will be only a temporary affair.The best way to deal with both the Parliamentary opposition to No Deal and the belief that the UK would come crawling back is for Boris to take a lead in the polls.If it was clear that a general election would lead to a majority for Boris, then Parliament would be less likely to throw obstacles in his way.That’s why Boris, in his Downing Street speech, tried to address the issues that cost the Tories their majority in : Social care, schools funding and police cuts.If the EU thought that Boris could do No Deal, and could politically sustain it, then it would have to decide whether it was prepared to compromise to avoid No Deal.The Irish Taoiseach, Leo Varadkar, would have to decide whether it is worth sticking with a backstop that is going to cause the very thing it was meant to avoid, a hard border on the island of Ireland.Varadkar would also have to consider whether he really wants to go through with No Deal when it would do more damage to the Irish economy than the UK’s. This is where David Frost comes in.No, not the late, great TV personality but the former Foreign Office diplomat who is going to be Boris’s point man for negotiations with the EU.Frost knows his way round the chancelleries of Europe, he is a former Foreign Office Europe Director and he also knows what Boris wants on Brexit.He was his special adviser when Boris was Foreign Secretary and was there when Boris decided to quit over Mrs May’s Chequers plan.His role is to craft a Brexit agreement that delivers what Boris thinks the UK needs AND one that has a chance of being accepted by the EUthe alternative is No Deal. This isn’t going to be easy, and it isn’t going to be done quickly.Those involved admit thatthe EU is going to blink, it will not be until the October EU Council at the earliest, which is just two weeks away from the October  deadline. As one of those working in the new No puts it: “Fasten your seatbelts, it’s going to be a bumpy ride.”But after years in which the EU thought they had the measure of the British Prime Minister, we now have a team who might just have what it takes to pull Brexit back from the brink. Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: university degrees slam doors shut
story: A decent set of A-level results and the kids can get themselves into a university. There, they can enrol in a course on gender studies and emerge in three years with a degree which will not help them one bit to get a decent job.And as a consequence they will be at least £, in debt. But they’ll have a piece of paper which will tell possible employers: “Look — I’ve been a total mug for three years. Gizza job!”The unemployment rate for students at Britain’s worst universities, such as East London and London South Bank, is around about double the national rate for young people.In other words, going to university worsened their chances of getting a job.That’s not what they were led to believe, is it. They were told a university degree would open doors for them. Not slam the doors shut in their spotty faces. And leave them with a whopping loan to pay off.Our young people have been conned for far too long.We have a new Prime Minister now. And I think it would be a good ideahe took a very close look at higher education. OK, he’s got Brexit to sort out first, fine. But by November , this should be his priority.We are misleading our young people. Far too many -year-olds go to university and end up mired in debt, with rotten degrees in stupid subjects. While all students have to scrimp and save to get through their three years.Here’s what I would doI were Education Secretary.End all tuition fees right now. Make university education absolutely free, and make sure those who go get decent living grants.How do we pay for that  Easy. Cut the number of people going to university by  per cent. Not everyone is academically minded. University should be only for those who are.Back when I went to uni only ten per cent of my peer group got in.But for the rest there were apprenticeships. Learning in the workplace. And those sorts of options should be considered not inferior to university, but absolutely equal. And the benefits stressed to the kids.Three years after leaving school a university kid will be earning nothing. If you’ve been on an apprenticeship for three years you’ll be earning a decent whack.We have over-stressed the importance and attraction of a college education to our young people, given them unrealistic expectations and made them pay through the nose for it. And at the same time we’ve devalued education by doing this.So there’s the challenge, Boris. Get on to the private sector and get some more apprenticeships up and running.And close down the awful former polytechnics charging a king’s ransom for a crap degree.ONE of the best things about BoJo becoming Prime Minister is that the perpetually screeching Yasmin Alibhai-Brown has vowed to leave the country.Brown loathes the white English working class.So it was always a mystery to me why she stayed in the country. Seeing as there are quite a lot of white, English, working-class people.Anyway, she vowed to get the hell outJohnson became PM.Trouble is, people say stuff like this but rarely act on it.I suggest we set up a crowdfunding page for her plane ticket and maybe throw in some extra money for en-route snacks and stuff.Off you go to Heathrow, Yazza.I MADE a list a few weeks ago about the  things I most dislike in the world.At No was Andrew Lloyd Webber musicals.At No was Taylor Swt.And No was cats .So take a guess as to what new film I’m not going to be watching any time soon It’s my nightmare, all wrapped up in two hours.CARL BEECH made a series of outrageous claims of sexual abuse, torture and murder by members of the old Conservative establishment.This serial liar and fantasist will soon be sentenced for his crimes.The reason the police believed this madman is because they have been told they must. They are no longer allowed to employ common sense.In order to be politically correct they have had to shed all semblance of judgment.THE job of a bookshop, you would have thought, is to sell books.Trouble is, they are useless at it. They are politically biased and cater solely to a tiny minority of gibbering liberals.I’ve got a book out at the moment, called The Great Betrayal – The True Story Of Brexit. I’ve had complaints from people who want to read it that they can’t find it in bookshops.The bookshop staff say they thought there wouldn’t be any interest in it. But it was the No best-seller in the country and was No on Amazon worldwide. It’s pure political bias.If you want the book – go on Amazon.TOP prize in the “Most Rational and Measured Response to Boris Johnson Becoming Prime Minister” goes to – of course – .For this headline: “The Clown Is Crowned As The Country Burns In Hell.”Followed by , words of hysterical drivel.Brilliant. The Left really don’t like it when they don’t get their own way.Anyway, this is but the first example of BDS – Boris Derangement Syndrome. Don’t worry. Lots more of it to come.MAGIC grandpa has a cunning plan!The Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn announced to the Press that he was going to “surprise Boris Johnson” by calling a vote of no confidence.Here’s a tip, you Jew-bothering, bearded c**kwomble.If you want something to be a surprise for someone, don’t tell every newspaper in the country.THE Islamist crackpots in Iran have hijacked two of our oil tankers. Causing a pretty grave crisis.But why isn’t the Royal Navy escorting British ships through the Strait of Hormuz, when we know the danger  Andthey’re not ready yet to do that, why did we impound an Iranian tanker three weeks ago, knowing there would be reprisals We have been naive and underprepared. I’m not sure anyone has noticed yet.Anyway, she immediately demonstrated her full-blooded support for democracy.She said evenpeople voted leave in a second referendum, she’d still ignore it.Swimsuit only likes democracy when people vote the way she wants. Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: work ban hot temperatures labour
story: Leader Jeremy Corbyn has vowed to put an end to sweaty workplaces.Employers will have to introduce air conditioning, extra breaks and let staff turn up in shorts and T shirts under the plan.And workers doing physically tough jobs will get to down tools over C .Shadow business minister Laura Pidcock said: “As we’re all being reminded this week, working in hot conditions is really uncomfortable, often stressful and it makes us less productive and even ill.“Plus it’s often the lowest paid and most insecure workers who suffer the most.Labour said global warming means sweltering heatwaves are here to stay.But their proposals risk fuelling the problem by forcing employers to install energy-guzzling air conditioning units – which is adding to climate change.The free-market think-tank, the Institute of Economic Affairs, said Labour is just chasing headlines and that employers already have to provide a ‘reasonable’ temperature.The IEA’s Andy Mayer said: “Labour’s proposal, while eye-catching, would make no one better off, but instead reduce the flexibility of employers to manage those risks.“What is appropriate for the socialist book store in Islington is not appropriate for a foundry in Sheffield or kiln in Stoke.“Micro-legislating in this way will simply add to their costs and risk unemployment.”Britain has been baking in a heatwave this week, with temperatures set to soar to C  today.GOT a story  RING The Sun on    or WHATSAPP on  or EMAIL exclusive@the-sunOur journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: mum kicked out council home neighbours
story: Kelly Barraclough was booted out of the house in Hull after locals complained of punch-ups and drug-fuelled all-night parties.The house has now been sealed up and the locks changed after Barraclough was turfed out.But the mum-of-one moaned she is a “victim” despite her doors being smashed up and walls ripped down.Barraclough said: “I know what they’ve all been making out. I had parties but they were at Christmas time – everyone has parties at Christmas.“I’ve had people coming round for a drink on a weekend but they’re more social gatherings. It’s just a couple of my friends.”She added: “People have got it in for me. I’m part of the community here and the people that are making these statements about me are the ones that no one really likes.”Locals said Barraclough, who has a six-year-old son, hosted raucous parties where teens took drugs and played loud music into the early hours.Fights often erupted in the street during her spell at the house, with fed-up residents complaining to the council.One neighbour said: You hear screaming and shouting and last night my electric meter got broken which turned all my power off.They throw stones at my windows and it’s like a siege. Apparently her house has been wrecked and it’s unlivable.Another young local mum said she was threatened by people in the house.Photos show garbage piled high in the front garden, damage to the house, broken windows and obscene graffiti scrawled in the house.Interior walls were booted down before Barraclough was handed a possession secured in court by the council.Councillor Mike Thompson said her eviction was a “last resort”.He said: “In this case, we felt the only way to safeguard others against Ms Barraclough’s appalling behaviour was to seek possession of the property.“The way she had treated both her home and her neighbours was utterly unacceptable, showing absolute disregard for anyone .”Barraclough was given  days to leave the house, which has now had its locks changed.But defiant Barraclough insists she is being targeted in a smear campaign.She said: “I’m certainly not the first person around here that has been a victim of one neighbour’s complaints.“I’m the victim in this sense and part of a wider campaign and there are six or seven other residents who have also been victims.”It’s not known where she has now moved to.

title: girl topless verify gaming app gacha life
story: Cahla McGarry was playing on the dress-up amime game when she received a private message requesting a photo of her bare chest.The message told Cahla the group is a ‘safe space for girls under ’ and she would have to send a topless photo to prove she met the guidelines - or  she would be ‘permanently banned’.But mum and secondary school teacher Nicola McGarry, , who has strict parental controls on all of Cahla’s devices, regularly warns her daughter of the dangers of speaking to strangers online.And instead of replying to the ‘sickening’ message, savvy schoolgirl Cahla immediately showed it to her mum.The widowed mum-of-one, of Prestwick, South Ayrshire, Scotland, says this incident highlights how easy it is for ‘predators to slip through the net’.Nicola said: “I was scared. It felt asthey had intruded into our home. Although it’s probably someone thousands of miles away, it really felt like an intrusion into our privacy.The schoolgirl loves the game so much, she wanted to chat to other players and share her character creations so she joined a Gacha Le forum on the Amino app.Amino is an app dedicated to communities, chat, forums, and fan groups so people with shared interests can connect.As well as the vile request, the fake employee also used the threat of being banned from the app in a bid to manipulate Cahla into complying.The aim is to collect rare gems by playing mini games to unlock levels.Using Gacha Studio mode players can create unique scenes to tell their own stories by using Gacha Le characters.It is free to play. The message read: “Welcome to this amino group. My name is Mandy and I work with amino.“Soyou don’t know this is a safe space for young girls. We require users to be  and younger. If you fit these requirements you can be here.“We also have to make sure that all members here are girls. To very this I will need from you a photo of your bare chestand age.“This is just an extra security feature but all members must do this. Users that refuse to do this will be permanently banned.”Amino Apps said they have ‘zero-tolerance’ for inappropriate contact with minors and report all incidents of child sexual exploitation to the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children.An Amino spokesperson said: “Keeping Amino safe is our top priority. We have zero-tolerance for any type of inappropriate contact with minors.“Our team works   across seven supported languages to remove content and users in violation of our policies.“We automatically remove nude imagery in order to prevent inappropriate content from being sent or received here, and we deploy the most advanced technologies available to assist with the enforcement of these rules.“While we are unable to provide any information about this particular case, we report all incidents of child sexual exploitation to the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children , and we fully cooperate with law enforcement agencieswe receive requests for information.“We are absolutely dedicated to maintaining the trust and safety of the Amino .”Gacha Le developers Lunime Games, who are in no way connected to Amino, were concerned to hear of such a ‘serious situation’.A Lunime Games spokesperson said: “This is a very serious situation but it seems that this more concerns the Amino app than our app Gacha Le.“There is no way to send another user an image in our game, which we did to prevent issues like this from happening.”The Sun is currently running an investigation into Snog.FM - a teen dating site where perverts have been caught targeting underage girls.

title: man feet were torn off accident walks again
story: The mans legs were trapped and his feet torn off after he fell into a ribbon blender at a textile factory on a night sht in Bangkok, Thailand.Paramedics scooped up his mangled feet and rushed the factory worker to hospital.There, leading reconstructive surgeon Dr Wichit Siritattamrong, who was called in during the night, took over the mans case.He arrived back at work and took his patient straight into surgery, in a bid to save his feet.Dr Siritattamrong worked through the night, operating for seven hours to re-attach the bones, ligaments, blood vessels and nerves.He then inserted steel rods to hold the mans severed limbs in place.The surgery took place in December , but Dr Siritattamrong is sharing the medical report now, after his patient finally learned to walk again.The unnamed man has even managed toto work at the same factory where the accident happened.Dr Siritattamrong said the patient, who passed out after the horric accident, woke up the next morning and was amazed that he was alive - and stunned that his feet were re-attached.The patient had a metal frame around his leg for three months - both internally and externally - with the internal steel rods remaining in place for two years, allowing the bones to heal.He was confined to a wheelchair before having physiotherapy.Dr Siritattamrong added: After two years without walking, the brain has forgotten how to walk.The man needed to learn the process all over again which took him almost a year until he would walk.It has taken three years of rehabilitation but not he is able to walk around almost like a normal person.Dr Siritattamrong said that even though the surgery is high risk, he performed it anyway. But he cautioned other less experienced medics from trying the same operation.He said: When these kinds of accidents happen the important issues that should be considered are, firstly,the patient can use that organ again Another is about the beauty of the result, will it look normal  If one issue among the two is positive, then it is worth performing the surgery.The doctor said he doesnt feel any pressure during the operations but admits that it is hard dealing with the expectations of patients.He added: I have been working as an orthopaedic hand and reconstructive surgeon for over  years and now. Honestly, this situation is pretty normal to me.But the most hard part was dealing with the expectation of patients and their relatives. They always expect everything to be perfect, which is impossible.

title: boy operation tongue stuck bottle
story: Riley Wooff, from Lancaster, needed emergency surgery after his tongue went black and rapidly swelled in his mouth.His mum Clare, , realised something was terribly wrong when her son when he started shouting that his song was suck as he sat in the back of the car.After several attempts, frightened Riley begged her to ring an ambulance but Clare rushed him to Lancaster Royal Infirmary, Lancs, where several medics also failed to remove the lid.As the little boys tongue continued to swell Clare was taken aside and told he would need major surgery - but there was a risk it could kill him.A team of  medics attended Rileys operation and were finally able to remove the lid under sedation, meaning he left hospital with his tongue still intact - albeit with a temporary speech impediment.Now Clare is calling on parents to throw out any similar water bottles without safety gauze in to protect the tongue and is urging Sainsburys to recall these bottles.Clare, from Carnforth, Lancaster, said: It was the scariest day of our lives.To think this is an everyday item most kids would have in their school lunch boxes - its scary.To other parents, please, just throw them away. Even as an adult, its easy to put your tongue in these bottles messing around.I think all bottles should have a gauze or something to stop this happening again - and Sainsburys should also recall [those that dont].After being taken to Lancaster Royal Infirmary, his mum admits she still had no idea how serious the accident was - until doctors warned they would need specialist surgeons.We went in to AE and a nurse couldnt loosen it either. Riley was really upset and screaming.A doctor managed to get the bottle off, then it was just the lid stuck on his tongue.There were about four specialists and  doctors at the end of his bed discussing what to do.He said they were going to operate but they didnt knowwed need to be sent to Alder Hey Hospital. They didnt have the equipment.They didnt want to take to Alder Hey by ambulance because it was an hour and a half away from us. And they didnt want to risk Riley having dficulty breathing in the ambulance as they wouldnt be able to save him.The doctors said this is a real risk. The risks are he could lose his breathing when we cut the lid off. The swelling could go down his throat and he may need a tracheotomy, which would land him in intensive care.He also said he had a big risk of heart attack because when the tongue is released, all the blood would circulate quickly and one of the major veins is in there.The surgeons said this is really serious. We need to warn you he could die.They took him up to theatre and managed to sedate him, not put him to sleep.They took the bottle off and he managed to handle his airways fine.When the brave patient came out of surgery, his tongue was so swollen he couldnt put it back in his mouth.After an overnight stay he was discharged, but days later his tongue is still peeling and swollen, leaving him with a speech impediment.A Sainsbury’s spokesperson said: “We are investigating this isolated incident with our supplier and wish Riley a speedy recovery.”

title: michael gove ordered to speed up no deal planning after boris puts him in charge of cabinet office
story: The pair appear to have buried the hatchet and vowed to work together in the new PMs Government to finally deliver the result of the referendum.Last night Boris gave his old enemy a job in the Cabinet Office where he will oversee No Deal prep across Whitehall.The ex-Environment Secretary, a long-time supporter of our EU exit, will work with Boris new adviser Dominic Cummings, the mastermind behind the Brexit Vote.Mr Gove has previously expressed concern about leaving without a deal, and will be keen to make sure that one is done.But he wont be anywhere near the talks in his new role.The move shows the pair appear to have put their  feud behind them, where Mr Gove ditched Boris leadership campaign and decided to run alone.Today Boris paid tribute to Mr Gove in his first Commons speech and said hed asked him to make it his top priority.He said that he would turbo charge our preparation to make sure there is as little disruption as possible to everyday lewe leave with No Deal.And the extra £billion of cash Britain would not pay to the EU in the event of a No Deal would be to be used to smooth things over, he added.All necessary funding will be made available from the Chancellor, Boris promised.The civil service have been asked to mobilise and deliver whatever outcome might happen, he added.Brexiteers have hit out at civil servants in the past - who they think are biased against our EU exit and determined to stop it.Boris has said he would much prefer to get a deal, but today insisted it cant have the Northern Irish backstop in it.

title: uk weather forecast today heatwave 2019 hottest day
story: The mercury had already hit C in London by mid morning amid health warnings, fears of melting pavements and rail chaos on what is being dubbed Furnace Thursday.By lunchtime, it was officially the hottest day of the year so far as the mercury hit .C at Heathrow.Brits have been warned to stay at home and avoid travelling as temperatures rise dramatically across the UK.Those that did travel were sweltering on slow-moving, packed trains as speed restrictions to prevent buckled rails sparked delays and cancellations.Ramblers collapsed in the heat in Dorset, surfaces melted in Grimsby and Londoners faced searing heat on the Tube with the high humidity expected to make temperatures feel like C in the South East this afternoon.According to the Met Office, there is a  per cent chance the mercury could rise above the current all-time UK temperature record today.Some forecast models show the high humidity levels could make the temperature feel like C today.The hot weather is blasting in from an African plume of Saharan air, causing the record-breaking hot weather.Public Health England has issued a warning advising vulnerable people, especially older people and young children, to stay hydrated and stay indoors to keep cool.Medical experts are warning that few hospitals are prepared for the impact of the intense heat.People are being urged to take precautions against the heat by avoiding exercise and wearing loose, light clothing.The scorching conditions may spark thunderstorms which could trigger travel delays, flash flooding, and power cuts, the Met Office said.Experts at the Met Office say the current weather pattern is driving hot air from the south, but there is no doubt climate change is playing a role in what could be unprecedented temperature highs.A yellow weather warning is in force for most of England, except the south west, and parts of Scotland from pm on Thursday until am on Friday.Residents in Bristol have been left without water on the hottest day of the year, after a water main burst.To combat the issue, people living in the east and north of Bristol have been given bottles of water to keep them cool as temperatures are set to soar to C.Across the country, firefighters are tending huge blazes, as the lack of rain and rising temperatures are turning the UK into a tinderbox.A barn holding  tonnes of straw and hay has gone up in flames at Kintbury, Berkshire, and  firefighters have been battling another huge blaze in a barn in Pymore, Dorset.Commuters on the Central and Bakerloo lines of the London Underground this morning sweltered in temperatures of at least .C.The sweltering conditions prompted Network Rail to impose train speed restrictions in areas where tracks were at risk of buckling.Southeastern railway even urged commuters to avoid travelling, as services were expected to experience huge delays.Extreme weather action teamswere activated to keep passengers safe and trains running.Now emergency services warned the public to take precautions during the extreme heat.Temperatures reached .C on the Central Line yesterday.Commuters were snapped appearing rather worse for wear, on packed Tubes.Hundreds of thousands of commuters faced delays, cancellations and overcrowding today.Officials have also highlighted the risks of cooling off in the sea, lakes and rivers.The Rail Delivery Group, which represents the industry, advised passengers in London and the South East to change their travel plans today because of the expected heat.As the mercury rises, the steel rail absorbs heat and expands, causing it to curve, known as buckling.The temperature change provokes pushes and pulls the track out of shape.Met Office Meteorologist Matthew Box said it is more likely both the .C July record and the all-time maximum of .C will fall before the end of the week.He said: “We now think there is an -per cent chance that the July record will be broken on Thursday with a -per cent chance the all-time record will fall.“Models indicate a lot of warm air coming up from the Continent especially across eastern parts of the country.“High pressure is over the Continent and this allowing energy from the sun to heat the region, this air is then going to come up and into the UK.“There is a chance that it will turn slightly fresher as we go into the weekend, however, eastern Britain could remain very warm.”As temperatures soar across the country, emergency services warned the public to take precautions during the extreme heat and highlighted the risks of cooling off in the sea, lakes and rivers.

title: aboard double decker lies checker
story: NewsAll aboard our double decker lies checker: Mirror Bus takes Boris to taskThe Mirror double-decker, backed by union the GMB, set off in London yesterday as we vowed to hold him to account for every untruth utteredShareCommentsByPaul RoutledgeAndy LinesLiz Dunphy:,  JUL NewsThe Mirrors Boris Bus as it travels through central London "Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailPlenty of you reckon lying chancer Boris Johnson would throw the nation under the bus to advance his own interests.And he pretty much proved this with his Vote Leave battle bus and its whopper about £million a week for the NHS after Brexit .So we decided to get a special service on the road – dedicated to following his journey as Prime Minister and keeping an eye on every twist and turn of his route. The Mirror double-decker, backed by union the GMB, set off in London yesterday as we vowed to hold him to account for every untruth uttered, launching hashtags #BorisLieBuster and #WeAreWatchingYouBoris. And the reaction made us wonder how long it will be before his time in the UK’s driving seat is over. The open-topper had dozens of passengers and crowds cheered it around Parliament Square and Westminster.    Boris lookalike Drew Galdron sang songs including I’m the King of the Bungle – and Fleetwood Mac’s Little Lies boomed out over the speakers. But behind the fun, the message was deadly serious. GMB members waving placards bearing some of his porkies urged Boris to drop his hardline Brexit stance – and stop lying now he has won the highest office. Chief Tim Roache warned: “We’re watching you, Boris. No-deal Brexit will bring ­political Armageddon. Boris offers no hope to workers.” Harry Picken, , of Barnes, South West London, has just graduated from Lancaster University in history and politics. He said: “Boris represents everything wrong about society. “He is not someone [to] be trusted. He was part of a campaign that lied. He doesn’t intend to unite the country.”    Christine Golding, education convenor for the GMB and chair of the National School Committee, said: “When I found out Boris was going to be Prime Minister, I was angry. “His record doesn’t come across as someone listening to us. I want to know what he’s going to do for education. I work with people who have two jobs and still can’t afford to live. How is he going to help  We’ve been decimated in schools. Is he going to put money back in  Of course he’s not.” And teacher Sophie Ingram, , from Suffolk, said: “I’m scared for the future. I have to teach ‘British values’ of tolerance and respect and Boris is not the poster boy for that.  The children I teach are scared too. Tory austerity has meant some teachers feed pupils and even their parents.” Our passengers made it clear that as we buckle up for a bumpy ride with Boris, we must hold him to account. The Mirror will not let him use lies to steer us down the wrong road. Paul Routledgeaposs view The top deck of the Mirror Boris Lie Buster bus was the coolest place in London. We caught the breeze while our Boris lookalike was shooting it. Tourists gawped, motorists hooted their horns in support and sightseers even thought he was the real thing. Three years ago the Johnson bus lied to take us out of the EU. Yesterday the Mirror Liebuster bus told the truth. Our Boris exposed the porkies in songs like I’m The King Of The Bungle and It had To Be Eu-Who-Who… On College Green by Westminster we even got a wave from hardline Tory Brexiteer Nigel Evans MP. Army veterans obviously thought our PM was the real deal because they shouted: “Don’t forget your promises.”

title: alastair campbell i know what
story: NewsopinionAlastair Campbell: I know what it takes to be PM and it wont end well for BorisBoris is lazy. That doesn’t mean he can’t put in the hours. But they are devoted to the game of politics and media, not the hard graft of policy and delivery.ShareCommentsByAlastair Campbell:,  JUL NewsopinionBoris Johnson and Alastair Campbell "Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailWhat a turnaround for David Cameron. As his career burnt in the ashes of a party ­management tactic – the EU ­referendum – he was destined to go down as the worst Prime ­Minister of modern times. Three years later, he is only the third worst. He lost the referendum. Theresa May failed to deliver on the result. Despite her “legacy tour” and though there is some “poisoned chalice” sympathy, she ­nonetheless left office having failed in virtually everything she set out to do. The burning injustices still burn. Brexit has not been ­delivered.  Now Boris Johnson takes over. I see no way that can end well for him or, more importantly, for Britain. I predict he will be even worse than his predecessors.    Those of us on the losing side of political arguments right now must be humble enough to admit we could be wrong, and that he may prove us all wrong. But I have known Johnson for a long time. First, as fellow ­journalists. Then, with him covering the government I worked for. Then, with both of us on the political front line. Now, with me as a commentator cum anti-Brexit campaigner and him as Prime Minister. It is hard to compute.  Because I can think of no other senior position being filled by someone so unqualied to do the job, especially at this crucial time for the country. Older readers may remember when a businessman called Michael Knighton took over Manchester United. When I think of Johnson, I think of Knighton ball-juggling at Old Trafford. I am currently – thank God, given what is happening back home – in Australia.    And the general impression I get from Aussies is that they think, what with Brexit and now Johnson, the Mother Country has gone bonkers.   In his head, Johnson is Winston Churchill. In truth, he is a pound-shop Trump. He lies with the same ease as the US President. Like Trump, he seeks credit for anything good. Think London Olympics, in which he played a minor role but used it to promote himself, as he does with everything he touches. Like Trump, he shts blame when it should be his. Think the failed vanity projects, like his island airport or his garden bridge. And also, think of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratclfe languishing in Iranian jails and psychiatric units while the man, who made it so much worse for her, enters Downing Street to take charge of UK foreign policy.  He is lazy. That doesn’t mean he can’t put in the hours. But they are devoted to the game of politics and media, not the hard graft of policy and delivery. He is dismissive of detail. He is loose with his language as well as his morals. He is a bad judge of character. He is untrustworthy. He has no moral compass or fixed beliefs – hence writing two articles, one for Remain, one for Leave, before deciding that his own interests in the referendum were best served by backing Leave. Everything he has e ver done in his le has been largely about himself, his profile, his career. And that same narcissism is reflected in his personal le where, as his famous shouting match with his current girlfriend Carrie Symonds appeared to show, it all has to be on his terms and to hell with the consequences for others.  Fair play to him on one level – everything he set out to do he has done it. Got all the positions he sought at Eton and Oxford. Made a name for himself as a journalist not least in Brussels by making up stories and, to the Daily ’s shame, getting away with it. Edited a magazine. Won a seat in Parliament. Won two terms as Mayor of London, historically a Labour city. Made history in leading the winning side in the referendum. Became Foreign Secretary. And now, the job he always saw as his destiny, sitting in Churchill’s chair.  But now he is there, his mettle will be tested as never before. He will have a large number of right-wing press sycophants who will help cover up his failings and exaggerate his successes.

title: attorney general ordered apologise after
story: NewsAttorney General ordered to apologise after breaking financial interest rulesGeoffrey Cox - a millionaire who once tried to claim p for milk - has been rapped for the second time after previously declaring £, of outside earnings lateShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  JUL Updated:,  JUL NewsGeoffrey Cox has been rapped by the Commons standards watchdog "Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Attorney General has been ordered to apologise to Parliament after he breached rules on declaring financial interests. Millionaire Geoffrey Cox - who is the top lawyer in Boris Johnsonaposs new Cabinet - was rapped by the Parliamentary Standards Commissioner over the failures today. The watchdog found he declared rent from a London home more than a year late. The Commons Standards Committee said it was a oversight and genuine misunderstanding but Mr Cox must apologise in writing to the House of Commons.It is the second time the QC, who once tried to claim p for milk, has been rapped by the Commissioner after declaring £, of outside earnings late in .Mr Cox broke rules which said any property giving a rental income over £, a year must be registered within  says.    The MP, who was appointed Attorney General in July , registered such income from his former London residence in January . He admitted at the time that he was declaring it late, as the property first became registrable in September . But it later emerged he was wrong and the property should have been registered from  November . He accepted responsibility for the error, which he said arose from a misunderstanding of the interpretation of the rules, a report today said. The Standards Committee said: We do not consider that Mr Cox’s two errors in the present case constitute serious breaches of the rules the first arose from an oversight and the second from what was clearly a genuine misunderstanding.
